home.askFirstQuestion: Be the first to ask a question!

questions.title: Title
questions.questionTitle: What's your programming question? Be specific.
questions.questionBody: Include all the information someone would need to answer your question
questions.questionTags: Add up to 5 tags to describe what your question is about

tags.title: Tags
tags.description: A tag is a keyword or label that categorizes your question with other similar questions.
tags.usageHelp: Using the right tags makes it easier for others to find and answer your question.

descriptions.javascript: For questions regarding programming in ECMAScript (JavaScript/JS) and its various dialects/implementations (excluding ActionScript). Please include all relevant tags on your question.
descriptions.python: Python is a multi-paradigm, dynamically typed, multipurpose programming language. It is designed to be quick to learn, understand, and use, and enforces a clean and uniform syntax.
descriptions.c#: C# (pronounced 'see sharp') is a high level, statically typed, multi-paradigm programming language developed by Microsoft.
descriptions.java: Java is a high-level object oriented programming language. Use this tag when you're having problems using or understanding the language itself.
descriptions.php: PHP is a widely used, open source, general-purpose, multi-paradigm, dynamically typed and interpreted scripting language originally designed for server-side web development.
descriptions.html: HTML (HyperText Markup Language) is the markup language for creating web pages and other information to be displayed in a web browser.
descriptions.android: Android is Google's mobile operating system, used for programming or developing digital devices (Smartphones, Tablets, Automobiles, TVs, Wear, Glass, IoT).
descriptions.css: CSS is a representation style sheet language used for describing the look and formatting of HTML, XML documents and SVG elements including colors, layout, fonts, and animations.
descriptions.Reactjs: React is a JavaScript library for building user interfaces. It uses a declarative, component-based paradigm and aims to be both efficient and flexible.
descriptions.node.js: Node.js is an event-based, non-blocking, asynchronous I/O runtime that uses Google's V8 JavaScript engine and libuv library.

posts.noPostsYet: No posts yet. Be the first to share!
